item.title: Nacon Faces Closure After Filing For Emergency Insolvency
item.content:encoded:
Nacon, a major French publisher and holdings company, has this morning revealed a dire situation. In a new press release, the company has revealed it has filed for insolvency after its parent company, Bigben, entered a period of financial difficulty.

In the release, it was stressed that Nacon will need to undergo a ‘rapid implementation of a financial restructuring’ to survive and has requested a judicial reorganisation review to facilitate this. Nacon’s ‘available assets’ are now substantial enough to meet its due liabilities, and it will now assess critical pathways out of this situation.

Nacon Could Shut Down If The Worst Happens

In the new press release, published this morning at 8 AM CET, Nacon’s representatives wrote:

To date, the Company reports that its available assets do not allow it to meet its due liabilities. In this ucontext, the Company will, as of today, file for insolvency (“déclaration de cessation des paiements”) with the Court and request the opening of judicial reorganisation proceedings (“redressement judiciaire”).

The aim of this procedure is to assess all possible solutions to ensure the sustainability of the Company’s activity under the best possible conditions, protect employees, and preserve jobs, while renegotiating with its creditors in a calm and constructive framework

The company’s shares have ceased trading on the Paris market, and a court hearing has organised for early March to review the next steps for the firm.

Nacon was founded in 1981, dabbling in publishing, software, and peripherals over the years. It famously had a stint of distributing Sega’s Dreamcast consoles at the turn of the millennium. The company was originally known as Bigben Interactive, but it restructured in 2019, consolidating resources under the new ‘Nacon’ banner to bring together a dedicated gaming brand.

Bigben Group became the majority shareholder in Nacon, assuming control of more than 76% of shares.

This insolvency threatens a whopping 11 studios, including Spiders, Daedalic, Big Ant, Cyanide, and Kylotonn, all of which sit under the Nacon banner.

Cyanide is best known for the recent release of Styx: Blades of Greed. Big Ant is a studio focused almost exclusively on sports titles, Kylotonn most recently released Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown, Spiders is the developer behind GreedFall, and Daedalic infamously developed The Lord of the Rings: Gollum most recently.

The company is yet to deliver on the publishing and release of multiple games:

  • Gear.Club Unlimited 3
  • GreedFall 2: The Dying World
  • Cthulu: The Cosmic Abyss
  • Endurance Motorsport
  • Edge of Memories
  • Dragonkin: The Banished
  • Hunting Simulator 3

Nacon’s employees were notified of this news yesterday, February 24, and Nacon has promised to ‘keep the market informed as the situation and the proceedings develop.’

Are you shocked at this news? Let us know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Gray Zone Warfare is now a PvE-first shooter

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: All Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos Timed Research Codes & How to Claim Them
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon Go offers a slew of content in the build-up to Go Tour Kalos, including some exclusive Timed Research that players must claim through code redemption.

Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos takes place this weekend, February 28 to March 1, and comes off the back of Pokémon Day on Friday, where a slew of exciting news from the franchise is set to be shared.

If you want to make sure you don’t miss out on the Timed Research Codes in Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos, Insider Gaming has the crucial details you need.

All Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos Timed Research Codes

There are several Timed Research Codes available to claim around Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos, with Unown the featured Pokémon in each.

Various Unown forms are the focus of the Timed Research during the Kalos Tour, including X & Y, the games where Kalos first featured, and Z & A, referencing Pokémon Legends: Z-A, where players returned to Lumiose City.

Timed Research codes, as the name suggests, are only available to complete and earn rewards for a limited time. The tasks are easy to complete, however, and you should be able to tick through them quickly while you focus your attention on all the other offerings during Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos.

All the Timed Research codes for Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos are shown in the table below, alongside the Pokémon they feature.

How to Redeem Timed Research Codes in Pokémon Go

All Pokémon Go Timed Research Codes must be redeemed on the Pokémon Go webstore, and cannot be redeemed directly within the app.

While this isn’t ideal if you’re out and about, the redemption process is quick and easy, with rewards available in the app immediately once redeemed.

The precise steps to redeeming the Timed Research Codes in Pokémon Go are shown below.

  1. Head to the Pokémon Go webstore.
  2. Sign in to your account.
  3. Click on the ‘Code Redemption’ option at the top of the page.
  4. Enter the code and click ‘Apply.’
  5. When successfully redeemed, a notification will appear from Pokémon Go on your device.
  6. Open Pokémon Go and complete the tasks!

What are you most excited to see during the Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, read about the rumors of a Fortnite collab, and find out the exact start times for Pokopia.

item.title: Today’s Quordle #1493: All Answers & Hints For February 25, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Quordle takes the complexity of the original daily word game and ups the ante by having you solve four solutions at once. Your 100% attention suddenly needs to be diverted four ways, and completing the daily Quordle is tough without the right starting words or hints. February 25, 2026, Quordle is the #1493 edition of the puzzle, and there are four new words for you to find. This guide has hints and a helping hand to help you solve all four words.

Before the information comes thick and fast at you, make sure you give today’s Quordle a go if you haven’t already!

How To Play Quordle Daily Word Game

Quordle is different from other daily word games because it requires you to guess four words at once correctly, and you can do so on the official Quordle website.

Before anything else, check out this set of instructions on finding and playing Quordle:

  1. Go to the Quordle website.
  2. You are shown four equal lines reminiscent of a Wordle setup.
  3. Enter your first guess using the keyboard input at the bottom of the screen.
  4. The game will fill out the first of nine lines for all four boxes.
  5. A green box means the letter is correct AND goes in that exact spot on the grid.
  6. A yellow box means the letter is correct BUT needs to go in a different spot on the grid.
  7. A grey box means the letter DOESN’T feature at all.
  8. Do this up to nine times to try to solve all four words.

Best Quordle Tips & Tricks

  • Try to use as many of the five vowels as you can in your first two guesses.
  • Focus on solving words with more green and yellow boxes first.
  • Avoid reusing letters that are not applicable across any of the four answers.
  • Don’t be afraid to try the same letter twice in one word, as answers can be sneaky like that.
  • Play the Practice game first if you’re not used to Quordle, or need a warm-up before today’s new game!

Quordle Hints For Today, February 25, 2026

Top-left grid

  • Hint 1: Large ox-like mammal.
  • Hint 2: Makes a good meat for protein.

Top-right grid

  • Hint 1: A sharp object
  • Hint 2: Made famous by Wesley Snipes.

Bottom-left grid

  • Hint 1: A private book.
  • Hint 2: A journal of events and experiences.

Bottom-right grid

  • Hint 1: You can have one of these stuck in your side.
  • Hint 2: Protruding sharply from a tree.

Starter Words For February 25, 2026 Quordle

You should consider using one or more of the following words to get you started with today’s new Quordle puzzle:

  • HAIRY
  • ADORN
  • BLESS

SPOILER WARNING: The answers will be revealed next!

All Today’s Quordle #1493 Answers For February 25, 2026

Get ready for all four of today’s Quordle answers, starting from the top-left grid, then the top-right, then the bottom-left, and finally the bottom-right.

When Is The Next Quordle Daily Game?

Quordle is updated daily at 12 AM (Midnight) in your time zone and region, so the next game will start on February 26.

The Quordle schedule is very consistent and always comes out at the same time each new day.

What Is Quordle?

Quordle is a variation of the popular Wordle daily word game, but instead of giving you one word to solve, you must figure out four unique words at the same time.

Needless to say, Quordle is MUCH harder than Wordle! There are days when it might be an achievement just to solve one of the four words. Whereas you can guess Wordle with your first answer, that’s impossible with Quordle. You need to be thinking on all cylinders with Quordle, and Insider Gaming strongly recommends you take the hints above on board and apply them to future Quordle puzzles.

Additionally, a new daily guide will be on the website for every new puzzle. Keep coming back each day for hints and solutions to the newest Quordle daily word games!

How did you find today’s Quordle? If you have any feedback on what you want to see added to these guides, share your thoughts via the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

You should also check out IG’s other word game guides:

  • NYT Mini Crossword Hints Today—Answers For Wednesday, February 25
  • Today’s Contexto #1256: Hints & Answer For February 25, 2026
  • Today’s Strands #724 Hints and Answers for February 25, 2026

item.title: NYT Mini Crossword Hints Today—Answers For Wednesday, February 25
item.content:encoded:
The NYT Mini Crossword is a popular, quick-to-complete word game to test yourself daily, but some of the puzzles can be difficult to complete.

If you’ve found yourself stuck on today’s NYT Mini, Insider Gaming has some helpful hints and all the answers for the NYT Mini Crossword on Wednesday, 24 February, 2026.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of the NYT Mini Crossword. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How to Play NYT Mini Crossword

The NYT Mini Crossword is available to play on the New York Times Games app or website, but, as of September 2025, a New York Times Game subscription is required.

The NYT Games Subscription is priced at $6.95 per month, but there are introductory offers available for other NYT subscriptions that include games access, which might be worth considering.

Without a Games subscription, access to the NYT Mini Crossword is blocked.

NYT Mini Crossword Clues (Feb. 25)

Here are all the clues provided for the NYT Mini Crossword for February 25, 2026.

Across

1 – Computer function represented by a floppy disk icon

5 – Want more than anything

7 – Enticed, with “in”

8 – In the company of

9 – Something to do “like it’s 1999”

Down

1 – Leftover morsel of food

2 – Fragrance

3 – What a humidifier emits

4 – Curling or speed skating, for the Winter Olympics

6 – Risque

Additional Clues For NYT Mini (Feb. 25)

Here are some additional clues to help you solve the NYT Mini Crossword on February 25, 2026.

Across

1 – A safety point in a video game

5 – Pregnant women’s desire for food items

7 –

8 – Popular multiplayer game, ___ Us

9 – Celebratory event, like a birthday

Down

1 – Unwanted metal

2 – Sweet scent

3 – Liquid substance in the air

4 – Special content in a game, eg Anniversary ____

6 – Not at ease

All NYT Mini Crossword Answers (Feb. 25)

Here are all the answers for the NYT Mini Crossword on February 25, 2026.

Across

1 – SAVE

5 – CRAVE

7 – ROPED

8 – AMONG

9 – PARTY

Down

1 – SCRAP

2 – AROMA

3 – VAPOR

4 – EVENT

6 – EDGY

When is The Next Game?

The NYT Mini Crossword refreshes daily at 10 PM ET on weekdays and Saturdays, and at 6 PM ET on Sundays.

As such, the next NYT Mini Crossword will be available at 7 PM PT/9 PM CT/10 PM ET/3 AM GMT/2 PM AET.

What is The NYT Mini Crossword?

The NYT Mini Crossword was introduced in 2014 as a shorter and quicker-to-complete game to accompany the main New York Times Crossword, which was initially released in 1942.

Until September 2025, the NYT Mini Crossword was free, but it has now been consolidated into a monthly NYT Games Subscription alongside several other popular games.

Did you struggle with the NYT Mini Crossword today? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more word game hints, take a look at the hints and answers for today’s Contexto, and check out hints for today’s Strands.

item.title: Today’s Contexto #1256: Hints & Answer For February 25, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Contexto is a word association game that gives you a new word to guess every single day. With every attempt, the AI algorithm determines how close your guess is to the daily answer based on thematic and contextual similarity.

Sometimes, though, no matter how experienced you are, the word you’re looking for can be incredibly vague and hard to deduce. Luckily for you, this guide is full of hints to give you a helping hand, but make sure you give today’s Contexto a go if you haven’t already!

How To Play Contexto

Contexto is incredibly simple to play, but difficult to master. All you have to do is type words into the search bar, and the AI algorithm will tell you how close your word is to the answer.

You’ll know how close your guess is based on the colour of the bar and the number next to it.

  • Red includes guesses with the number 1,501 and above, meaning you’re way off from the secret word.
  • Orange includes guesses between 301 and 1,500, meaning you’re getting closer, but still some ways off.
  • Green includes guesses between 1 and 300, meaning you’re on the right track.

Best Contexto Tips & Tricks

  • Start off using broad terms, then narrow down once you’ve got under the 1,000 mark.
  • Try using Nouns first, and dip into verbs or adjectives once you’ve discovered the context.
  • Experiment with random words at times, especially as different forms of a root word can rank differently, such as work and worker.
  • Guess away, as unlike other word games like Wordle, you aren’t limited to a strict number of attempts.

Best Starting Words For Contexto

Here are some great starting words to get you going with Contexto:

  • Thing
  • Person
  • Place
  • Animal
  • Work
  • Nature
  • Game
  • Concept
  • Idea
  • Food

Contexto Hints For Today, February 25, 2026

Without giving away today’s Contexto answer, here are a few helpful hints to get you thinking in the right direction:

  • Hint 1: Type of food
  • Hint 2: Healthy snack
  • Hint 3: Type of melon

If they don’t help, then here are the nine closest words, going from tenth to second:

  • Cucumber
  • Sorbet
  • Guava
  • Pineapple
  • Papaya
  • Nectarine
  • Watermelon
  • Cantaloupe
  • Melon

Today’s Contexto Answer For Game #1256 On February 25, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, and still can’t figure out today’s Contexto answer, then you can find it down below:

Answer: Honeydew

A Honeydew is a variety of melon with smooth, pale skin and sweet, green flesh.

When Is The Next Contexto Game After #1256?

Contexto is updated daily at 12 AM or Midnight in your respective time zone, meaning the next game will start on February 26

The Contexto schedule is very consistent, with a new game releasing at the same time every day.

How did you find today’s Contexto? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more daily guides, check out IG’s other word game guides:

  • NYT Strands
  • Wordle

item.title: Today’s Strands #724 Hints and Answers for February 25, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid.

Whether it’s your first time playing or you’re a Strands veteran, today’s tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Strands, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #724 for Wednesday, February 25, 2026

To play today’s Strands, head to the game’s website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of Strands. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There’s also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don’t fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website. You can also play on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 25, 2026

The Strands’ answers for Game #722 are all related to a very specific musical instrument. Think Johnny Cash, Elvis Presley, and Jimi Hendrix. If you’re a wrestling fan, think Jeff Jarrett, the Honky Tonk Man, and Elias. Bear in mind that the answers are all generic things in relation to the instrument.

General Strands Hints For February 25

Without giving today’s Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: Red __, come on over.
  • Hint 2: DirecTV used to install these on your roof.
  • Hint 3: Aliens will sometimes do this to humans they abduct in sci-fi stories.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #724 for February 25, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 25, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you unlock some in-game hints. A few starter words that may help are:

  • RATE
  • TELL
  • ROVE
  • SATIRE
  • RATE

Today’s Strands Answer For Game #724 On February 25, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today’s Strands below. Check out the answers for yesterday’s puzzle here.

  • PROBE
  • ORBITER
  • MODULE
  • LANDER
  • ROVER
  • SATELLITE
  • SPANAGRAM: SPACECRAFT

If you solved today’s Strands without our answers, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #724?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 26 will be Strands Game #725.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid. The game’s original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle’s success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.
